titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Andrew Henry Woods (1872-1956) was a physician and psychiatrist. In 1899 he went to China to help found the medical department of Canton Christian College (later Lingnan University). His wife was Fanny Soutter Sinclair who graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1901. They were married in 1902. Woods was the first head of the Department of Neurology at Peking Union Medical College and at the Iowa State Psychopathic Hospital and Department of Psychiatry at University of Iowa.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Andrew Henry Woods and his family. Materials include: diaries and journals (1885-1956); correspondence; photo albums, photographs, and postcards from Woods' time in China; drawings and photographs created by Margaret Woods; a travel journal and photographs of Tom S. Woods; family correspondence of Fanny Sinclair Woods; reprints of articles by Andrew Woods; clippings and medical journals from Woods's work in Iowa hospitals; and miscellaneous diplomas and certificates.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
